channel.title: Wanting to host private server
channel.description: Im not looking for anything crazy i picked up the atomicscape base and khanz ip changer. I dont have wifi at home and i just want to host it on my computor for me to run a client while i work on it. I tried the 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, i even did the ipconfig to try that route aswell, the server starts up but the client wont connect.... Help?

item.title: Wanting to host private server
item.dc:creator: @jay2kay jay2kay
item.description:
@jay2kay wrote:

Right about now i would settle for any revision running offline, i have ran servers before (562, 525, & 317) about 2 years ago. Ill keep looking for a bundled client. I have ran of localhost but the port wasnt something i had thought about. Ill double check with the codes and let you know about any good news

Read full topic

item.title: Wanting to host private server
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I’d hate to be that guy but there are tutorials for this.

I would simply recommend downloading a source and client package, and changing the IP that the client connects to in the actual client files. Clients that have a built in IP changer sometimes aren’t the same revision as the source you’re using, or they can be a bit buggy. Download a client and source package and try changing the IP in the client files and let us know how that works out.

Read full topic

item.title: Wanting to host private server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure both (if applicable, not all server’s require the IP) the client and server are on 127.0.0.1 (localhost). Also make sure the server is 100% online before running the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Wanting to host private server
item.dc:creator: @runeball runeball
item.description:
@runeball wrote:

change ur client ip to Localhost if it still doesn’t work then check if the port in the server connects to the same port of the client.

if its still not working then i don’t know the answer

Read full topic
